instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1297 820-2914-B replaced 216-0810084 with 216-0810005?
threads.message: After replacing 0084 with 005 there is picture, OS doesn't boot, ASD EFI finds no errors, is it even possible?

threads.title: A1297 820-2914-B replaced 216-0810084 with 216-0810005?
threads.message:
Have you checked the strapping resistors? 
What VRAM is the board sporting? 
It sounds more like a soldering issue, but it could be VRAM straps

threads.title: A1297 820-2914-B replaced 216-0810084 with 216-0810005?
threads.message: No desire to mess with this. Only thing I can say is compare the strapping resistors like R8610/11/12/13 to a board with 0005.

threads.title: A1297 820-2914-B replaced 216-0810084 with 216-0810005?
threads.message:
make sure plug in the battery,otherwise it won't boot into OS.
some 84 board replaced with 005 would work fine, some needs the bios to be re-flashed
